newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada sends fraud suspect back to Germany.
newsitem.headline: Canada sends fraud suspect back to Germany.

text.p: A man who allegedly bilked German investors out of millions of dollars and then hid out in Canada now faces extradition, Canadian Press reported on Saturday.

Rudolf Kretz, 43, wanted by Stuttgart police as a "major suspect" in a C$5.5-million fraud scheme involving 314 investors, was ordered on Friday to surrender to German authorities by Canadian Federal Court Judge Keith Hoilett, the news agency said.

Kretz's lawyer, Erik Polten, said his client believes he is the scapegoat for two German brokers who are the real thieves. Kretz, who was given landed immigrant status in Canada in 1993, has 30 days to appeal the ruling.
